cases.title: Quetta Civil Hospital Bombing
cases.summary: A suicide bombing at Quetta’s Civil Hospital killed approximately 70 people, mostly lawyers. The attack was claimed by ISIS and Jamaat-ul-Ahrar.

cases.title: Enforced Disappearance of Baloch Students
cases.summary: Security agencies continued to abduct Baloch students and activists. Hundreds of new disappearance cases were reported nationwide in 2016, with a large portion from Balochistan.

cases.title: Quetta Police Training College Attack
cases.summary: Armed militants stormed a police training college in Quetta, killing 61 cadets. The attack highlighted the grave security threats faced by civilians.

cases.title: Enforced Disappearance and Kill-and-Dump Policy
cases.summary: Many missing persons turned up dead in 'encounter' shootings or with torture marks. Security forces were accused of a 'kill and dump' policy targeting Baloch nationalists.

cases.title: Gwadar Construction Workers Massacre
cases.summary: Balochistan Liberation Army gunmen killed 10 Punjabi laborers near Gwadar working on a CPEC road project. The attack targeted outsider communities.

cases.title: Nazar Mohammad Baloch Case
cases.summary: The bullet-riddled corpse of Nazar Mohammad Baloch, a missing student, was found in Turbat. This case is emblematic of countless unresolved killings.

cases.title: Mastung Election Rally Bombing
cases.summary: A suicide bomber targeted an election rally in Mastung, killing 149 people including candidate Siraj Raisani. The Islamic State (ISIS) claimed responsibility.

cases.title: Record Surge in Disappearances
cases.summary: COIED received 1,098 new disappearance complaints in 2018, the highest annual figure on record. Many cases are from Balochistan.

cases.title: UN Working Group on Enforced Disappearances
cases.summary: The United Nations urged Pakistan to end impunity, noting that hundreds of cases in Balochistan remain unresolved.

cases.title: Hazara Killings in Quetta
cases.summary: A series of targeted killings against the Hazara Shia community in Quetta prompted a week-long sit-in for protection. Army Chief Gen. Bajwa visited Quetta and promised improved security.

cases.title: Marketplace Attack on Hazara Civilians
cases.summary: Islamist extremists attacked a Quetta marketplace, killing 5 Hazara civilians. The US designated Pakistan a 'Country of Particular Concern' in 2018 for egregious violations of religious freedom.

cases.title: Quetta Election Day Bombing
cases.summary: A suicide bombing in Quetta killed 31 voters on polling day. The Pakistani Taliban and ISIS tried to disrupt the democratic process.

cases.title: Awaran Encounter Killings
cases.summary: Several young men were shot by paramilitary troops in Awaran district in what locals claim were staged gunfights. No transparent investigations were conducted.

cases.title: Naqeebullah Mehsud Killing
cases.summary: 27-year-old Naqeebullah Mehsud, an aspiring model from Waziristan, was killed by Karachi police in a staged encounter. His death sparked nationwide outrage and the Pashtun Tahafuz Movement (PTM).

cases.title: Disappearances of Sindhi Activists
cases.summary: Dozens of Sindhi nationalist activists disappeared in 2018, notably Ghulam Hussain Sindhi. The UN Working Group on Enforced Disappearances repeatedly cited such cases.

cases.title: Jalil Khaskheli Disappearance
cases.summary: Poet and activist Jalil Khaskheli disappeared from Sindh; his whereabouts remain unknown. The UNPO and Sindhi diaspora groups raised these cases at the UN Human Rights Council.

cases.title: Ghotki Anti-Hindu Violence
cases.summary: After a Hindu school principal was falsely accused of blasphemy, mobs ransacked a Hindu temple and vandalized Hindu homes in Ghotki. The incident drew condemnation from the Prime Minister and international community.

cases.title: Niaz Lashari Killing
cases.summary: The tortured body of Sindhi activist Niaz Lashari was found in Karachi. Lashari’s extrajudicial killing prompted the Sindh High Court to order police to register a case.

cases.title: Ashok Kumar Blasphemy Case
cases.summary: A 40-year-old Hindu businessman, Ashok Kumar, was arrested under blasphemy charges in Mirpurkhas. This fueled fear in the Hindu community.

cases.title: Police Killing in Shikarpur
cases.summary: Local police in Shikarpur shot dead an unarmed man, Irfan Jatoi, in an alleged staged encounter. Protests erupted in Sindh; an inquiry found police culpable and a rare murder charge was filed against the officers.

cases.title: Irshad Ranjhani Disappearance
cases.summary: The widow of missing activist Irshad Ranjhani staged a hunger strike in Karachi, demanding information about her husband’s fate (missing since 2017).

cases.title: Jameel Chanan Arrest
cases.summary: Karachi police arrested YouTuber Jameel Chanan after he interviewed an exiled separatist leader online, charging him with sedition. Rights groups decried this as an attack on free expression.

cases.title: Mob Lynching in Kotri
cases.summary: A Muslim physician accused of blasphemy was lynched by a mob in Kotri city, Sindh. The incident reinforced fears of mob justice.

cases.title: Flood Relief Discrimination
cases.summary: During the 2022 floods, some Hindu victims in Sindh were initially overlooked in relief or faced discrimination at shelters. Civil society and media highlighted these inequities, leading to corrective measures.

cases.title: Mass Arrests Post-Imran Khan’s Arrest
cases.summary: Following the arrest of former PM Imran Khan, hundreds of PTI workers were rounded up in Sindh. Many were held under vague charges like rioting or sedition.

cases.title: Sindh High Court Orders Reopening of Fake Encounter Cases
cases.summary: The Sindh High Court in late 2024 ordered the reopening of cases of alleged fake encounters and custodial torture, including revisiting the 2018 Naqeebullah case verdict.

cases.title: Bacha Khan University Attack
cases.summary: Taliban gunmen attacked Bacha Khan University in Charsadda, killing at least 20 people, mostly students and staff.

cases.title: Shabqadar Courthouse Suicide Blast
cases.summary: A suicide blast at a courthouse in Shabqadar (Charsadda) killed 17 people. Jamaat-ul-Ahrar claimed responsibility.

cases.title: Mashal Khan Lynching in Mardan
cases.summary: University student Mashal Khan was lynched by a mob over false blasphemy accusations. The case became a symbol of religious intolerance.

cases.title: Kharqamar North Waziristan Incident
cases.summary: Security forces opened fire on a PTM protest in Kharqamar, killing at least 13 and injuring dozens. The incident drew international condemnation.

cases.title: Peshawar Madrasa Bombing
cases.summary: A bomb blast at a madrasa in Peshawar killed 8 students and injured over 130. UNICEF condemned the heinous attack on children.

cases.title: Karak Hindu Temple Attack
cases.summary: A mob burned down a historic Hindu shrine in Karak, KP. The Supreme Court took suo moto notice, ordering reconstruction of the temple.

cases.title: Peshawar Police Lines Mosque Bombing
cases.summary: A suicide bomber blew himself up in a mosque inside Peshawar’s police headquarters, killing 101 people, mostly policemen.

cases.title: Peshawar Ring Road Encounter
cases.summary: Two alleged militants were killed in a staged encounter by KP police. Families claimed they were in custody before the killings.

cases.title: Swat Valley Anti-Taliban Protests
cases.summary: Thousands in Swat valley protested the reappearance of Taliban militants, chanting ‘we want peace’. The government increased security in response.

cases.title: Hangu Mosque Bombing
cases.summary: A suicide bombing in Hangu, KP, killed dozens as believers marked Friday prayers. The UN Security Council and U.S. State Dept condemned the attack.

cases.title: Supreme Court Orders Compensation for Missing Persons
cases.summary: In a landmark January 2024 ruling, the Supreme Court ordered the government to compensate families of missing persons in KP whose custody by state agencies had been acknowledged.

cases.title: Freedom of Expression Restrictions
cases.summary: Multiple journalists and activists detained for social media posts. Reports of internet shutdowns during protests.

cases.title: Forced Displacement in Skardu
cases.summary: Hundreds of families forcibly displaced due to military operations. Reports of property destruction.

cases.title: Gulshan-e-Iqbal Park Bombing, Lahore
cases.summary: A suicide bombing targeted families celebrating Easter in Lahore’s Gulshan-e-Iqbal Park, killing at least 75 people, mostly women and children. Jamaat-ul-Ahrar claimed responsibility.

cases.title: Lahore Mall Road Protest Bombing
cases.summary: A suicide bomber targeted a protest on Lahore’s Mall Road, killing 14 people including senior police officers. The attack was claimed by Jamaat-ul-Ahrar.

cases.title: Election Day Violence in Lahore
cases.summary: A bombing outside a polling station in Lahore killed at least 3 people and injured several others. The attack was part of a series of election-related violence across Pakistan.

cases.title: Punjab Institute of Cardiology Attack
cases.summary: Hundreds of lawyers stormed the Punjab Institute of Cardiology in Lahore, leading to the deaths of at least 3 patients. The attack was widely condemned as a violation of medical neutrality.

cases.title: Enforced Disappearance of Hafeez Baloch
cases.summary: Hafeez Baloch, a Baloch student in Punjab, was forcibly disappeared in 2020. His case became a rallying point for student and rights groups.

cases.title: Motorway Gang Rape Case
cases.summary: A woman was gang-raped on the Lahore-Sialkot Motorway, sparking national outrage and protests demanding justice and police reform.

cases.title: Minar-e-Pakistan Assault
cases.summary: A woman was assaulted by a mob at Minar-e-Pakistan in Lahore on Independence Day. The incident highlighted gender-based violence and impunity.

cases.title: Jaranwala Anti-Christian Riots
cases.summary: Mobs attacked dozens of Christian homes and churches in Jaranwala, Punjab, after blasphemy allegations. The violence drew international condemnation.

cases.title: Mass Arrests After Imran Khan’s Detention
cases.summary: Following the arrest of former PM Imran Khan, Punjab police conducted widespread arrests of PTI supporters, journalists, and activists. Many were held under vague charges or without due process.

cases.title: Supreme Court Orders Compensation for Jaranwala Victims
cases.summary: In early 2024, the Supreme Court ordered the government to compensate Christian families affected by the 2023 Jaranwala riots, setting a precedent for state responsibility in religious violence cases.

cases.title: Deadly Crackdown on PTI Protesters
cases.summary: Multiple deaths and mass detentions during protests by Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) in Islamabad. Security forces reportedly used lethal and less-lethal force, enforced a communication blackout, and arrested over 600 protesters. At least six deaths, including four security officers, were reported.
cases.category: Freedom of Assembly / Unlawful Use of Force
